intro: Colladonia anisoptera, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water requirements. Colladonia anisoptera is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
